messages.title: Dear Fellow Islander
messages.content: In 2017, I had the honour of being elected as the Isle of Wight’s new MP. Since then, I have worked relentlessly to give the Island the strong and effective voice we need. Please see overleaf. Now that a General Election is taking place, I am seeking a second term as the Island’s MP to carry on with this crucial work. That is why I am asking for your support on polling day, so that I can continue delivering for the Island - and get Brexit done.

messages.title: Local Resident and Public Servant
messages.content: Bob was in the British Army - receiving a Military MBE - prior to becoming the Island’s MP. He served in Afghanistan and Iraq, returning home to the Island between tours. Bob was twice elected as an Isle of Wight councillor. He lives near Brighstone.

messages.title: Championing the Isle of Wight in Westminster
messages.content: Bob is a passionate advocate for our Island - and he gets results. Working with others, he has secured £48m for the NHS and £26m for Island Line. Sandown School and Venture Quays have been saved. Bob will continue to deliver for the Isle of Wight.

messages.title: Convinced Whitehall to Recognise Island Status
messages.content: Following Bob’s input, the Government is now looking at the extra cost of delivering public services in our island community. He persuaded the Prime Minister that we need an Island Deal - and has now set out an evidence-based case for future funding.

messages.title: Protecting Our Island & Housing for Islanders
messages.content: As an Islander, Bob has campaigned to improve the Island Plan. He is working with the Council to protect green fields, reduce housing targets and prioritise homes for local families. Bob will push for greater environmental protections for the Island.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Getting Brexit done, with Bob Seely continuing to deliver for the Isle of Wight
More funding for all pupils in every Island school
Support for economic growth in Island industries
Lower taxes for hardworking local families
